snippet: Isiah Thomas was fired by Florida International University as its basketball coach on Friday, and Donnie Walsh, Thomas’s successor as the Knicks’ president, began seeking work with another franchise.
abstract: Howard Beck On Basketball column holds that the coincidental career moves of Isiah Thomas and Donnie Walsh serve as a stark reminder of the power vacuum in the New York Knicks front office, and the political atmosphere that created it; Thomas was fired by Florida International University as its basketball coach, and Walsh, Thomas’s successor as the Knicks’ president, began seeking work with another franchise.
lead_paragraph: Isiah Thomas was fired by Florida International University as its basketball coach on Friday, and Donnie Walsh, Thomas’s successor as the Knicks’ president, began seeking work with another franchise.

headline.seo: Isiah Thomas Is Fired as F.I.U. Basketball Coach
